texts.value: Transporter that mediates cellular uptake of betaine and GABA in a sodium- and chloride-dependent process (PubMed:7589472). May have a role in regulation of GABAergic transmission in the brain through the reuptake of GABA into presynaptic terminals, as well as in osmotic regulation. Probably also involved in renal and hepatic osmotic regulation (By similarity)

reaction.name: glycine betaine(out) + 2 chloride(out) + 3 Na(+)(out) = glycine betaine(in) + 2 chloride(in) + 3 Na(+)(in)

texts.value: In kidney, locates in basolateral membranes of renal medulla. In liver, locates in hepatocytes cell membrane
Expressed in kidney, liver, heart, skeletal muscle, placenta, and a widespread distribution in the brain
Belongs to the sodium:neurotransmitter symporter (SNF) (TC 2.A.22) family. SLC6A12 subfamily

citation.title: Molecular cloning and functional characterization of a GABA/betaine transporter from human kidney.
Cloning and expression of a betaine/GABA transporter from human brain.
Complete sequencing and characterization of 21,243 full-length human cDNAs.
The finished DNA sequence of human chromosome 12.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).

properties.value: 4 GO annotations based on evolutionary models
Amino acid transport across the plasma membrane
Expressed in metanephros cortex and 108 other cell types or tissues
